page.title: 03ARMED FORCES DARTMOOR
page.content: There are six parallel mounds.The first mound consists of earth covered with grass.The soldiers used to lie on this to fire at the targets.The next three parallel mounds were also fired from but the soldiers climbed steps up an earth bank into the brick bunkers which had wooden covers.The last firing mound is approached by a wide slope and is closest to the targets. The target bank consists of earth and stone. Within the bank is a curved brick wall which forms a shelter with seats for the men operating the targets. The paper targets were wound up on steel frames. The pulleys and winches are still there. The last mound is formed by a three-sided red brick wall enclosing earth and sand to slow the impact of the bullets. Many bullets are still embedded here or just lying on the soil.
